trans-unit.source: An ASP.NET HTTP handler that processes a request for a Web services discovery document.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler> class, via its <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler.ProcessRequest%2A> method, processes an HTTP request for a discovery document.
A discovery document is represented by the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument> class and is usually serialized as a file using a .disco extension.
Web services discovery provides a mechanism for determining the Web services that are available at a given location.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler> class normally does not need to be used directly by a developer.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler"></xref> class.
Gets a value of `true`, indicates whether the instance of <xref href="System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler"></xref> (or a derived class) is reusable.
Handles an HTTP request for a discovery document, which is serialized to the HTTP response.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryRequestHandler.ProcessRequest%2A> method searches for applicable files within the file system path corresponding to the HTTP request's Uniform Resource Locator (URL).
The search may extend to subdirectories and switch target file extensions depending on what it finds in the root search directory.

The search process populates the <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument> object's <xref:System.Web.Services.Discovery.DiscoveryDocument.References%2A> property with files that are found.

The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Request"></xref> and <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Response"></xref> properties of the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> class are used for input and output, respectively.
